CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1941, pg. 9 reads: "Beautiful and Useful Gifts For Popular Matron - Mrs. James Calloway was hostess to a very elaborate kitchen shower on Thursday afternoon at her spacious and beautiful Mooseheart street home, in honor of Mrs. James McCloud. The afternoon was spent in playing games. Cocktails were served and a buffet luncheon, consisting of assorted sandwiches, coffee and cake.  The hostess received her guests in black crepe and the honored guest wore a navy blue tailored suit.  Mrs. McCloud was the recipient of many beautiful gifts.  Those who participated in afternoon of fun and gaiety are pictured: Mrs. Edith Whitaker, Nellie Kent, Mary Harris, Frances Johnson, Carol Williams, Carrie Rieck, Ann Hale, Lillie Mae Penn, Jeraldine Porter, Hazel Betters, Urshe Kincaide, Marie Winters, Catherine Streeter Wilson, Bessie Jackson, Abbie McCloud, Julia Calloway, Lil Mae Surcey. Left: Mrs. James McCloud and Mrs. James Calloway.- Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. James McCloud holding coffee pot, and Mrs. James Calloway, standing in front of table with tea set, "magic cooker," and other appliances, in Calloway home, Mooseheart Street
